sub_title: Business Area Supply Chain Manager at Akzo Nobel Head Office

profile_positions.description:
Performance Coatings represents roughly 33% of all Akzo Nobel business activities & is comprised of 5 Business Units.  The Business Area (B.A.) of Performance Coatings acts as the go between for all 5 Business Units and the Board of Management.  All Cap Ex funding requests in excess of € 1 MLN must be approved by the B.A. prior for submission to the board.  

My position reports to the B.A. Supply Chain Director.  Supply Chain is the new acronym within Akzo for Operations Management. 

Supply Chain within Akzo Nobel encompasses all Operations with the exception of R & D, Finance, Sales, & Marketing.  

The following best describes the principle tasks and goals of my position:

Optimize the use of capital assets across the Business Area.

Have a cohesive & strategic Site Policy and accompanying Investment strategy.  This defines sites as being strategic, critical, and simply a supply site.  Those sites requiring expansion need to be identified and planned for as do those sites that are a candidate for closure.  My position works with the Business Units (BU) to identify and find new sites that are sometimes single BU and sometimes multi BU to support sales growth in developing regions of the globe.

The 5 Business Units should be motivated and driven towards Operational Excellence which will be accomplished via Shared metrics, Personnel development, and Process improvement.

Finally, Akzo Nobel insists on having Sustainable Operations which are Safe and World Class in being Eco-sensitive as measured on the Dow Jones Sustainability Index.
profile_positions.title: Business Area Supply Chain Manager for Performance Coatings

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for all Liquid Operations occurring within the Interpon Powder Business Unit.  

This responsibility includes Cromadex sites across Northern Europe as well as Toll Manufacture suppliers for the Powder BU.

The Powder Coating sold often requires a liquid E - Coat Primer which is nominally utilized in the Architectural, Automotive, & Domestic Appliance Markets.  This liquid primer allows the Powder Coating to function properly as a top coat.  

Other liquid areas of responsibility include Automotive Wheel Coatings and Non-Stick Fluoropolymer Coatings.  These coatings are sold on a global basis and manufactured by a variety of sBU's around the globe.

profile_positions.description:
Globally responsible for site Operations in Brazil, China, Germany, England, Spain,  Singapore, and the USA.  

Designed and supervised construction of new factories / warehouse / laboratories in China, Germany, Spain, and 2 plants in Singapore.  Assisted with staffing and training these newly formed entities in conjunction with local management.  

Designed and managed significant upgrades in design and operation of sites in Runcorn, England and Frazier, Pennsylvania USA.

Led Operational upgrades in manufacturing processes in the grinding of resins & pigments as well as mixing and material handling.  Automated packaging equipment was institutionalized in selected sites under my direction.  Other automation updates included self cleaning process vessels & automated tank cleaning equipment.  

During my time with Whitford the sales increased by roughly 200% via organic growth.  This was primarily due to global expansion as well as upgraded product quality and processing methodology.  

I assisted in the installation of an ISO quality system on a global basis.

profile_positions.description:
I managed all aspects of an organization making flight hardware grade ablative components for aerospace vehicles.  I was involved in the engineering and program management of manned flight hardware ( Space Shuttle ) as well as hardware for the Delta 2 rocket series that launched the 24 GPS satellites currently in use today.  

I managed a team on the NASA Marshall Space Flight Center charged with the redesign of the Space Shuttle Solid Rocket Motor following the Challenger disaster.  

Other programs which American Automated made hardware for included TOW, Hellfire, Patriot, Tomahawk Cruise Missile, STAR motors launching satellites from the Space Shuttle, and FOG-M.  

I was the first employee of the Rogersville, Alabama plant and I built the plant, sales, and hardware associated with the business.

profile_positions.description:

Reinhold was a manufacturer of ablative composite structures for rocket nozzles, aircraft bodies, re-entry heat shields, and numerous commercial plastic moldings.  Commercial moldings included computer consoles for CalComp, Kawasaki snowmobile bodies, & Swimquip swimming pool filter housings.  

Aerospace programs that I was Program Manager on ( Total Control over all aspects of the Program reporting directly to the corporate President ) included Delta ( ground based satellite launch ), STAR motors ( satellite launch from space shuttle bay ), MX 2nd stage, MX 3rd stage, Patriot, Hellfire, MX re-entry heat shields, and numerous classified programs.
